title: NASA to continue Lunar Trailblazer recovery efforts through mid-June
summary:
NASA will continue efforts to restore contact with Lunar Trailblazer through mid-June, holding out hope it can still conduct its mission to search for water ice on the moon.
The post NASA to continue Lunar Trailblazer recovery efforts through mid-June appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA Stennis Employee Contributes to Innovative Work
summary: Living up to, and maintaining, the standard of excellence associated with NASA is what drives Robert Williams at NASA’s Stennis Space Center near Bay St. Louis, Mississippi. A native of Gulfport, Mississippi, Williams said he has had the opportunity to work with and be mentored by “some truly exceptional” engineers, some with careers reaching back […]

title: ESA unveils longest-ever dataset on forest biomass
summary: As the new Biomass satellite settles into life in orbit following its launch on 29 April, ESA has released its most extensive satellite-based maps of above-ground forest carbon to date. Spanning nearly two decades, the dataset offers the clearest global picture yet of how forest carbon stocks have changed over time.

title: New Polish Space Agency Chief Named After Abrupt Exit of Predecessor
summary:
Poland’s Minister of Development and Technology has announced the appointment of Dr. Marta Ewa Wachowicz as the new President of the Polish Space Agency (POLSA). Her appointment comes less than a month after her predecessor was abruptly relieved of his duties. On 19 February, a SpaceX Falcon 9 upper stage underwent an uncontrolled atmospheric re-entry […]
The post New Polish Space Agency Chief Named After Abrupt Exit of Predecessor appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Lockheed Martin delivers completed Orion to NASA for Artemis 2
summary:
Lockheed Martin formally delivered to NASA May 1 the Orion spacecraft for Artemis 2, keeping that mission on track for a launch in early 2026.
